reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Reduced sexual and Gender based violence: Core support to support the implimentation of 2016-2021 strategic plan

description.narrative: The Women in Law and Development in Africa (WiLDAF) is a non-profit making organization which was established and incorporated under the Companies Ordinance Cap 212 of the Laws of Tanzania in 1997. WiLDAF is a Pan-African women?s right network dedicated to promote and strengthen strategies that link law and development. The essence is to increase women?s participation and influence at the community national regional and international levels in order to enhance the protection and promotion of their rightsVio lence against Women and Children (VAWC) is still prevalent in the country. This is due to the issue of power imbalances and social norms which are embedded in Tanzania communities. Likewise the lack of comprehensive law sufficient protection and rehabilita tion services for VAWC survivors perpetuate the incidences. Human trafficking of women and children is also a challenge and the government is yet to fully comply with the minimum standards for the elimination of human trafficking.The right to access to jus tice in Tanzania is still a challenge particularly to women due to the existence of gender discriminative laws; cultural norms and costs associated with reporting and prosecution of GBV/VAC cases; inadequate financial resources; human resources; and infras tructure. Majority of Tanzanians do not have legal capacity to represent themselves in the court of law and the cost to hiring advocates is expensiveThe fund will contribute to the following Key Result Area of their strategic plan 2016-2022: 1: Increased accessibility to justice for Women Girls Children in particular victims of violence; Enactment of gender responsive policies and laws in Tanzania; Reduction of incidences of Violence against Women and Children in the targeted Tanzanian communities Strength ened the institutional capacity for proper coordination and management of organizational undertakings. WiLDAF is the main the implementing agent of the programme other actors are its members

The Women in Law and Development in Africa (WiLDAF) is a non-profit making organization which was established and incorporated under the Companies Ordinance Cap 212 of the Laws of Tanzania in 1997. WiLDAF is a Pan-African women?s right network dedicated to promote and strengthen strategies that link law and development. The essence is to increase women?s participation and influence at the community national regional and international levels in order to enhance the protection and promotion of their rightsVio lence against Women and Children (VAWC) is still prevalent in the country. This is due to the issue of power imbalances and social norms which are embedded in Tanzania communities. Likewise the lack of comprehensive law sufficient protection and rehabilita tion services for VAWC survivors perpetuate the incidences. Human trafficking of women and children is also a challenge and the government is yet to fully comply with the minimum standards for the elimination of human trafficking.The right to access to jus tice in Tanzania is still a challenge particularly to women due to the existence of gender discriminative laws; cultural norms and costs associated with reporting and prosecution of GBV/VAC cases; inadequate financial resources; human resources; and infras tructure. Majority of Tanzanians do not have legal capacity to represent themselves in the court of law and the cost to hiring advocates is expensiveThe fund will contribute to the following Key Result Area of their strategic plan 2016-2022: 1: Increased accessibility to justice for Women Girls Children in particular victims of violence; Enactment of gender responsive policies and laws in Tanzania; Reduction of incidences of Violence against Women and Children in the targeted Tanzanian communities Strength ened the institutional capacity for proper coordination and management of organizational undertakings. WiLDAF is the main the implementing agent of the programme other actors are its members
